newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures end off as upside move fails.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures end off as upside move fails.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei futures ended easier on Wednesday after veering near, but failing to breach, a key resistance level.
Dealers said interest was dampened by caution ahead of U.S. Federal Reserve chairman Alan Greenspan's two-part speech to the Senate Banking Committee on Wednesday and Thursday.
"People don't want to get themselves into an ugly position ahead of Greenspan," said a senior trader with an Asian house.
He said participants were also keeping to the sidelines ahead of a slew of Japanese economic data on Thursday and Friday.
The benchmark Nikkei 225 March contract finished 165 points lower at 18,975 after hitting a high of 19,245. Turnover was a light 14,475 lots.
Dealers said the March Nikkei needed to breach resistance at 19,250 convincingly to head higher.
On the downside, support is seen at 18,800 and 18,500.
The MSCI Taiwan index contract ended at 320.2 against its opening 326.5 on volume of 788 lots.
